name: Three Home Run Games Trivia Game | MLB Records | 10 Questions

questions.text: This slugger from the Cardinals hit 3 home runs in a game six times during his career, 1936-1951.
questions.explanation:
Johnny Mize.

	Mize, nicknamed the "Big Cat", had 3-HR games with three different teams during his Hall of Fame career:  the Cardinals, the Giants and the Yankees between 1938 and 1950.

questions.text: In 2001, this Cub became the first player to hit three home runs in a game three times during a single season.
questions.explanation:
Sammy Sosa.

	"Slammin' Sammy" had a great season in 2001 as he amazed baseball fans with his slugging prowess.

questions.text: Which one of these stars never managed to hit three home runs in a game during his career?
questions.explanation:
Rafael Palmeiro.

	Palmeiro hit 569 home runs during his career, yet he never was able to belt 3 in a single game.

questions.text: In 1884, I became the first player to belt three HRs in a game. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Ned Williamson.

	Some baseball historians scoff at Williamson's home run feats because he played at Chicago's Lakeshore Park, a stadium which featured "Little League" dimensions.

questions.text: In 1922, who became the first American League player to belt three home runs in a single game?
questions.explanation:
Ken Williams.

	Williams accomplished the "hat trick" in 1922. He was a star outfielder for the St. Louis Browns.

questions.text: Which Pirate player clubbed three home runs in a 1971 playoff game?
questions.explanation:
Bob Robertson.

	Robertson was a power-hitting first baseman for Pittsburgh who had 115 HRs during his career. Unfortunately, knee problems cut short his productivity.

questions.text: Who was the first member of the New York Mets to homer three times in a single game in 1965?
questions.explanation:
Jim Hickman.

	Hickman had a couple of good seasons for some woeful Mets teams. He is probably best remembered for hitting the single which drove home Pete Rose in the 1970 All-Star game.

questions.text: Which Dodger pitcher surrendered Reggie Jackson's third home run in game six of the 1977 World Series?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Hough.

	Hough's knuckleball obviously didn't "dance", for Jackson belted the first pitch into the deep centerfield bleachers. Three home runs on just three pitches for Jackson of Oakland.

questions.text: Which of these Hall Of Fame catchers did not have a 3-HR game during his career?
questions.explanation:
Carlton Fisk.

	Fisk and Yogi Berra are probably the two best catchers never to hit three HRs in a game.

questions.text: In 1935, Babe Ruth had his final 3-HR game as a member of which team?
questions.explanation:
Boston Braves.

	Ruth was a member of the Braves when he smacked three home runs against the Pittsburgh Pirates. They would be the last of the Bambino's 714 career home runs.
